meanings.definition: The quality or state of being harsh.
meanings.sent1: The harshnesses of his words made her cry.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's harshnesses towards the students were unnecessary.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the harshnesses of reality for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The harshnesses of winter seemed to never end.
meanings.sent5: The harshnesses of the desert sun burned his skin.

meanings.definition: Roughness or severity in treatment or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't bear the harshnesses of his criticism.
meanings.sent2: The harshnesses of the punishment shocked the students.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows were met with harshnesses from the grumpy neighbor.
meanings.sent4: The harshnesses of war left deep scars on the country.
meanings.sent5: The harshnesses of the storm caused damage to the crops.

meanings.definition: Unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses.
meanings.sent1: The harshnesses sound of the alarm woke him up abruptly.
meanings.sent2: The harshnesses texture of the fabric irritated her skin.
meanings.sent3: The harshnesses smell of the garbage made her wrinkle her nose.
meanings.sent4: The harshnesses light of the sun blinded him momentarily.
meanings.sent5: The harshnesses taste of the medicine made him grimace.
